poem:
"Of Giants and Shadows"

In granite towers, a governor speaks,
Words falling softly, yet stark,
Claiming knowledge of the Bronx's young hearts,
Tales woven from presumptive dark.

Silhouettes in the cement-cloaked garden,
Flicker, bearing hidden might,
In them, the word 'computer' lives,
Seared in by the city's light.

'Tis not given to Gods alone,
To define the scope of a child's fight.

Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
